monumentInformation.title: Who Built It
details: The Statue of Unity was commissioned by the Government of Gujarat and designed by Indian sculptor Ram V. Sutar.
The project was initiated by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who was then the Chief Minister of Gujarat, to honour Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel.

monumentInformation.title: Where It Is Located
details: The Statue of Unity is located near the Sardar Sarovar Dam on the Narmada River, in the Kevadia district of Gujarat, India.
It is situated in a scenic area, surrounded by the Vindhyachal and Satpura mountain ranges, making it a popular tourist destination.

monumentInformation.title: When It Was Built
details: Construction of the Statue of Unity began in 2013, marking a significant undertaking to create the world’s tallest statue.
The statue was completed and inaugurated on October 31, 2018, coinciding with Sardar Patel's 143rd birth anniversary.

monumentInformation.title: How Is It Protected By
details: The Statue of Unity is maintained by the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Rashtriya Ekta Trust (SVPRET), which oversees the monument and its complex.
The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) provides security for the statue and its premises, ensuring the safety of visitors.

monumentInformation.title: Why It Was Built
details: The Statue of Unity was built to honour Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, India's first Deputy Prime Minister, for his role in uniting the country post-independence.
It serves as a symbol of national unity and integrity, commemorating Patel’s contributions to the integration of India’s princely states into the Indian Union.
